meanings.definition: A loose outer garment worn by Muslim men.
meanings.sent1: The djibbah kept him cool in the hot desert.
meanings.sent2: He bought a new djibbah for the special occasion.
meanings.sent3: The djibbah looked like a flowing river in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a comforting djibbah in a world of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The colorful djibbah fluttered like a gentle butterfly.

meanings.definition: A long, loose-fitting robe worn in North Africa.
meanings.sent1: She admired the intricate patterns on the djibbah.
meanings.sent2: The djibbah swayed gracefully as he walked.
meanings.sent3: The djibbah seemed to dance on its own in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: His words wrapped around her like a warm djibbah.
meanings.sent5: The djibbah billowed like a cloud in the sky.
